result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Mause Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered sentence WITHHELD with credit for 37 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges within 9 months or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
No violent contact with Ossie F. or the defendant's mother, if requested and approved by agent.
AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: *With credit for 83 days served; Huber privileges for work.

Court orders all costs, surcharges and DNA surcharge, to be paid by 04-28-2017.
Failure to pay penalty is civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm. Court orders all costs, surcharges and the DNA surcharge to be paid by April 28, 2017 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing hearing on revocation proceeded.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 83 days served; Huber privileges for work.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
The defendant was not produced from the House of Correction.  Case adjourned to March 18, 2016 at 8:30 am for sentencing hearing on revocation in Branch 4.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court by phone, defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court, in custody at the House of Corrections not produced.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney notified his client had called him from the House of Corrections and that he wasn't being produced for court. Defendant needs to appear for the Sentencing hearing on revocation order. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing on Revocation in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING Proceedings commencing December 16, 2016  (19 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Clerk contacted Jackie at the Public Defender's office to schedule matter for sentencing hearing on revocation.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled on March 16, 2016 at 1:30 pm.  Clerk advised Jackie that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Clerk requested transcript of December 16, 2016 sentencing hearing.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Br. 21
for review. os

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, Defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties prepared to proceed with Sentencing on 12-16-2015 at 08:30 am in Branch 21.   Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State's file is not in court.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered discovery turned over withing 10 days.  Defense withdraws speedy trial demand.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin with student intern Lauren Maddente.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  The State's file is not in court.  Court ordered case adjourned so bail can be revisited.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 37 (HONORABLE JUDGE T. CHRISTOPHER DEE) FOR BRANCH 24 (HONORABLE JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ) 

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court via-telephone, defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for bail-bond hearing. For reasons stated off the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Case is adjourned to Branch 37 for Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court prior to case being called.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a pre-trial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ossie F

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Mario Mause Jackson in custody.  Student Intern Matt Adrian under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mario Mause Jackson not in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/11/15 @ 1:30 pm
